verses.roman:
karmabhir bhrāmyamāṇānāṁ
yatra kvāpīśvarecchayā
maṅgalācaritair dānai
ratir naḥ kṛṣṇa īśvare

synonyms: karmabhiḥ—by our fruitive actions; bhrāmyamāṇānām—who are made to wander; yatra kva api—wherever; īśvara—of the Supreme Lord; icchayā—by the desire; maṅgala—auspicious; ācaritaiḥ—because of works; dānaiḥ—because of charity; ratiḥ—attachment; naḥ—our; kṛṣṇe—for Kṛṣṇa; īśvare—the Lord.
translation: Wherever we are made to wander about this world by the Supreme Lord's will, in accordance with the reactions to our fruitive work, may our good works and charity always grant Us love for Lord Kṛṣṇa.
